Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The documentary series finished airing ages ago. Why is PBS sending another crew?

Quote.Speaker: Camera Man
Quote.Text: We're getting bonus footage for the DVD.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: pff, Nobody buys DVDs anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Camera Man
Quote.Text: It'll be a pledge gift.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: PBS. The propaganda wing of Bill and Melinda Gates and viewers like you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In the past year, I have consolidated the entire Scranton paper market. We regained the white pages, the school district, Lackawanna county. We supply them all. I'm getting married tomorrow afternoon, and in the morning, there's a mini-reunion. A kind of a "where are they now" panel at a local theatre. It'll be nice to see everyone again. [laughs] I haven't seen Kevin since we let him go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [mimicking trumpet] Today marks several important milestones. Stanley, as you know, is retiring.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! Whoo, whoo, whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ah, I've been looking forward to this day since I was 18 years old.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Speech!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! And our next and most thickly frosted cake is...for...Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! Wait, why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go ahead and just read the frosting.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: "Get out."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a colloquial way of saying "you're fired," Kevin, which you are.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? Dwight, you can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The cake has spoken Pam. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well if anyone here can make a case for Kevin staying.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Dwight...[overlapping objections]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Based...on his merit.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Umm....

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm...good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, Toby will stop it. Anytime anyone's ever been fired, Toby's blocked it, so...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah, I don't think...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Toby, wait. Wait. Hold that thought. Here's your cake. [squirts frosting on the top] Bye, bye Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [crying] At least I got chocolate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I bike to work now. Saves on gas, cheaper than a vasectomy and, uh, oh, yeah, it's good for the environment too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam and I are great. She just recently finished her mural for the Irish cultural center.

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: Whoo! Yeah

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Cici] Can you clap! Can you clap for mom?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And Dwight is imitating Japanese business practices for reasons he explained to us in Japanese.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] Angela, are you ready for the wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [whispering] Yes. My heart is so open, I am so at peace. [scoffs] Look at Meredith. She's disgusting. Those feet. They're like the paws of an orangutan.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think she looks good. Now that she's wearing sports bras, we don't see her boobs as much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is all. Have a good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [after Angela kisses Dwight] What was that for?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [laughing] To remind you that our wedding's gonna be wonderful.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah. I know. It just feels so empty with so many of the old gang gone.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: D, it's gonna be perfect. The only people that need to be there are you and me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, and the old man to feed us the cheese that he's been fermenting since the day of my birth. You keep forgetting about him.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't...I don't know why.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I brought in some new faces, and one old. I always like Devon. I hired him back after Creed faked his own death in the baler the day after the doc aired. The only person he fooled was Kevin. Then the police showed up. Turns out, Creed was in the band "The Grass Roots" in the 1960's. During that time, the police say he sold drugs and trafficked in endangered species meat and stole weapons-grade LSD from the military.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, some fudge?

Quote.Speaker: Malcolm
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. I love your fudge.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Malcolm
Quote.Text: I think I gained a couple of pounds since I got here.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [laughing] Oh, you can afford it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: After 16 years, it's strange sitting across from somebody who isn't Stanley. But...he'll get there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, the limo's gonna be here at five. I need everybody to be ready 'cause I want to pack in a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Party time! Whorehouse!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, no. No whorehouse. This is Dwight's night, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Well, you're the bestisch mensch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight has made me his bestisch mensch. Which is Schrute for best man. He's putting himself entirely in my hands tonight. And I know for over 12 years I've done nothing but trick and prank him but tonight...only good surprises. "Guten Pranken". [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh hey, Jim. I forgot to mention. Oftentimes, in Hollywood portrayals of bachelor parties, there are accidental murders. That won't be necessary tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Great, now we got three hours to fill.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, hold on. Are you sure Mose isn't going to show up?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ever since Angela moved in and Mose had to stop sleeping at the foot of my bed, he's been acting pretty weird about this whole wedding thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mose has been weird? That's so unlike him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure, I'll talk about it. Why not? American's next A Cappella Sensation aired my audition. And when I started sobbing uncontrollably, apparently that struck a chord with quite a lot of people. Not a very compassionate chord. The clip went viral, as they say

Quote.Speaker: Casey Dean
Quote.Text: [on computer] You can't just sit here and cry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, I can so just sit here and cry!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Two million hits in the first week and then the parodies started. One from the Philippines got 12 million hits. And the late night comedy guys had a field day with it.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [SNL Weekend Update]

Quote.Speaker: Bill Hader
Quote.Text: [fake crying]

Quote.Speaker: Seth Mayers
Quote.Text: Oh, Don't. Aw, come on, Baby Wawa. Don't be such a baby.

Quote.Speaker: Bill Hader
Quote.Text: [crying and pouring eye drops in his eyes]

Quote.Speaker: Seth Mayers
Quote.Text: Oh, No. It's gonna be alright.

Quote.Speaker: Bill Hader
Quote.Text: [pulling multiple tissues out]

Quote.Speaker: Seth Mayers
Quote.Text: It's gonna be all right. For Weekend Update I'm Seth Meyers. That's Baby Wawa. Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Bill Hader
Quote.Text: [still crying] Bye!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: After my clip blew up, I actually got a call from the double rainbow guy and the fat Star Wars kid. Turns out they have a support group. [pause] Not really my scene.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Years ago, the senator promised a left turn lane by the Arby's. So I wanna know where in the name of horsey sauce is it? Well, yeah, you...hold on.

Quote.Speaker: Dakota
Quote.Text: Hi. I keep seeing this symbol in the accounts from last year. It's..it's all over the place. I don't know what it means.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's the reason Kevin got fired. It's his magic number. He used to use it to balance his accounts. He used to call it a Keleven. He told Dwight, [imitating Kevin] "A mistake plus Keleven gets you home by seven." He was home by 4:45 that day.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, I live in Poland now. The Scranton of the E.U. Thank you for flying me out here for the weekend. I'm looking forward to the reunion panel tomorrow. Can't wait to see everyone. Well, almost everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hello! [laughing] Hello!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hi! [goes to hug Nellie]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh. [laughs nervously]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: How did you now my plane had arrived? How long have you been stalking me?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no. no. My plane just got in. From New York. Are you still with Piotr?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No. And I thought I unfriended you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Anyone can follow a Twitter feed. Wanna share a cab?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [alone in cab} After Dwight fired me, I moved to New York to write the great American novel. I have six roommates. Heh. Which are better than friends, you know 'cause they have to give you one month's notice before they leave.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey-OH!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're back?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Malcolm
Quote.Text: [whispering to Phyllis] That's Baby Wawa, right? Oh, my God!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey man, good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. Yeah,

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [hugging Andy]. Andy...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! Aw! A bear hug from my favorite mama grizzly.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy, I've been worried about you. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A little warm.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Poor, poor Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [struggling] Okay. Aw. Thank you Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hello, hello.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Darryl!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Didn't I just see you at the airport jumping in a limo?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What? Must've been another devilishly handsome debonair individual.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, man. How are you doing? I, um...I didn't call 'cause I figured you changed the number.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No I didn't change the number. All good though. Phone never rings.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? Ooh!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Surprise!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I thought you guys couldn't come.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, but then they moved the panel to the same weekend and the Doc crew paid to fly us in. It was kismet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Kismet? Yeah, right. Pam and I came up with excuses for every other weekend. You remember my two lap band surgeries, right? Neither do I? "Guten Prank" number one.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You ready for tonight? We gonna tear up the town?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, better ask Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And Jim will say nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [enters] Darryl! Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam! How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're fine. Yeah. [hugs both Darryl and Andy] And I'm sure that you guys are fine too. Because why wouldn't you be?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Darryl, oh, my gosh. How is Austin? Tell me everything. How's the merger? I feel like I read about Athlead all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I love it. And it's Athleap now. And the city is amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah, it's hot. The music is awesome. And the tacos are...for real.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! That sounds incredible. [checking cell phone]. Oh, guys. Limo's here. Let's do this. Change if you need to.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Whoo, whoo, whoo.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, you guys, have fun. You too, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aw!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Woah-Oh! Haven't been in one of these in forever.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: They wanted me to go to the bachelorette party with the girls. Really? Such a cliché. I'm a man. So I'm going to the bachelor party with the boys. I just have to remember how I acted before I came out.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: WASSUUUUP! [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, why are we stopping? Jim, this isn't on the itinerary.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Get out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim...wha... Come on! What...what are you gonna whack me, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, Dwight. You'll be doing the whacking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A bazooka. You remembered.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Of course I did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [tearful laugh]. Get out of my way.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: OH! [all laugh and applaud after Dwight fires the bazooka]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Woo! Okay!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah! [to camera] Guten Prank number two.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Private Room.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, brosef.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Enjoy, enjoy.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: Hey, I know you. Are you gonna sit here and cry?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, man, easy.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: [fake cries]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, dude, leave him alone. What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim, it's fine. He'll just get you on his cell phone and then that'll go viral.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That happens a lot?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess. But things are going well actually. I spoke at Cornell during commencement week. I mean, the seniors invited me as a joke but it was a huge success.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, I bet it was a smash.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's how I got my new job in the admissions office.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is that a volunteer program or...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. It's a job. Things are going great.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Let's get a drink in you, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Whoo-hoo. Let's get this party started!

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Where's my angel.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is my big sister Rachel.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: No, this is my big sister Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [laughs] We're very close. We even have our own special language.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: [speaks in a special language]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: People love it.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: They do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] Man, how long have we been sitting here?

Quote.Speaker: Stripper
Quote.Text: Hi, boys!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Ohh...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, Thank God. We are famished!

Quote.Speaker: Stripper
Quote.Text: Hey, did somebody order the chef special?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Right there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, we haven't ordered anything. No one's even taken our drinks. Uh, what is the chef special? [music plays and stripper starts dancing on Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Stripper
Quote.Text: I bet you boys have a big appetite.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, we do. So we'll have an onion loaf for the table, please. And tell us about your heartiest soups.

Quote.Speaker: Stripper
Quote.Text: Mm, I know what you want. I know exactly what you want.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, an onion loaf for the table but that's not all. Now the chef special sounded good. What is it exactly?

Quote.Speaker: Stripper
Quote.Text: Ohh, shh. [places finger over Dwight's lips]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, what are you doing? Are you giving me a taste of the chef's special? Tastes like cigarettes. That won't work. That's no good.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What? [knock at the door] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, boy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Jakey
Quote.Text: Heard you guys needed some pipes fixed or cleaned or whatever.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Angela's special repairman is here.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Wait, what is this?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Shut up. Jakey?

Quote.Speaker: Jakey
Quote.Text: Mom?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, wait. What?

Quote.Speaker: Jakey
Quote.Text: Oh, man.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. Just do your wok. Pretend mom's not here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, that seems inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Give the good show, my little entrepreneur.

Quote.Speaker: Jakey
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Take it off. [music play]. Yeah! Good song choice, Jakey. Stripper's only as good as his song.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: oh, wowee wow.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Whoo-hoo...go, Meredith's stripper son.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Rachel, are you all right?

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: I don't know! I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh geeze. [Jakey starts dancing on Angela]. Oh, my God!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Be gentle Jakey. Gentle. One second. Just one second. Look. [pushes Jakey aside and starts dancing on Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay, if anything, this is rougher. Stop it Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Fine. My bad. Go ahead Jakey.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Jakey resumes dancing] Uh, no. It's o...thank you. You know what? You don't have to...oh no, no, no. No, no, no. It's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now, for the last time, I'd like a side salad with balsamic.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Dwight, for the last time, she's not a waitress.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're telling me!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: If you want her to leave, just tip her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What for? We haven't even gotten bread yet. Does anyone wanna split a twice baked potato? [to the dancing stripper] Do you have those? Those aren't deep fried, right?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That was interesting. [creaking sound] What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's just the wind.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Will you lock the door?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay. [opens door] It's just the wind, see? Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Alright, see, you don't have to leave the door wide open. We get it. It's the wind. Just come and shut...[Mose grabs Angela and takes her away] OH! My God!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [screams]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: What's happening?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, man, never thought I'd say this but I think I ate too much bone marrow. [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, it's the girls. Hey Pam. What? Angela's been kidnapped! Phyllis left the door open and some freak came and grabbed her and fled.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good old Mose. [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: They think it was Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, great. He's getting into the spirit of the festivities. Fantastic. He just pulled off a Braut Entfuhrung.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A ceremonial bridal kidnapping. He will take the bride and hide her at a local pub and when I find the place, I have to buy everyone drinks. Ah, all right! Oh Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait a minute. You said the tradition is for the groom is search for her and it ends at a pub. So how about the last pub you'd ever set foot in in this town?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right. Which one is that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm, hey driver. Why don't you take us to 3030 Adams?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that Mose?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, it is! I am here for my bride!

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Well, first, buy us a drink.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: If you want your bride, buy us a drink! If you want your bride, buy us a drink.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very well! Drinks on me! Bartender! [Kevin turns around] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, well, well, well, well, well. That's six "wells." Did I get that number right, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I heard you bought a bar, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes. I did. This one. Now get out!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Mose] Why did you pick this place? [Mose points to Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You? You did this as a prank. My own Bestich Mensch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, not a prank. I think it's time for you to bury the hatchet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Waste of a good hatchet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, just talk.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, w...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I heard you say "well" the first time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know Dwight misses Kevin. I saw him make his portrait out of a Wooly Willy. Tomorrow's his wedding day. You can't be anything but happy on your wedding day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was nothing personal. It's just that you were terrible at your job.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You're just saying that to make me feel better.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No really. You were terrible at math and organization, time management, personal hygiene. Your internet searches were so filthy we had to throw our your computer.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Is that all it was?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Come here [hugs Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I missed you Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I missed you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ohh.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Guten Prank.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, Mose. Guten Prank number three.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You've had your drink. Now where is my bride?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mose! What..ooh, Mose. [Mose opens trunk]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What the [bleep] is your problem you [bleep] [bleep] [bleep]?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. Hey, is Angela coming or...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. We can't see each other on our wedding day. And her legs are still numb from being in the trunk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Stanley!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How's Florida?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, great.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm living in Florida now. Little town called Florida City, just on the edge of the everglades. The man who delivered my divorce papers came by fan boat which was kinda fun. I sit on my porch all day, carving birds.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Am I the only one that's nervous? How are you doing with this? Should we have bailed?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, I'm fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Doesn't seem like anyone cares about us anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I guess this was work being filmed nonstop for nine years.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm sorry guys. This is probably on me. I got hated on pretty hard when that auto-tune went viral.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: Just sit here and cry, just sit here and cry! Oh I can so just sit here and cry. You guys are really mean. It can't end like this you know. Slept in my car last night, quit my job. Burned all my bridges. And I did unspeakable things - You're just not good, you're just not good. - Are you insane? - You're just not good, you're just not good. - Chill out! [crying] Just sit here and cry...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [watching at his bar] People actually dance to this. It's in my juke box. None of the money goes to Andy though.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [laughing] Yeah, people hate you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'll go talk to the manager. Maybe we should just go home. [walks down the hall]

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Hey! It's Andy Bernard!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Nard Dog! [cheers and claps] Ree-De-De-De-Doo! [repeats]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ree-De-De-De-Doo!

Quote.Speaker: Man 1
Quote.Text: How did it feel to see your lives played out on tv?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: It's like seeing a documentary about how your food is made. It's kinda disgusting. You learn a lot, but I didn't wanna know any of it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: With today's modern surveillance technology we are in a constant state of being watched weather it's our government or the government of other countries a.k.a. Google. You guys are being filmed way more than we ever were.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Uh, no one recognizes me. But not all my friends call me Plop. So... thanks PBS.

Quote.Speaker: Woman 1
Quote.Text: Uh, Jim, that DVD in the last episode was so romantic. And, um, I think we'd all love to know, Pam, what romantic thing did you do to pay Jim back for leaving Athlead?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I mean, How do you pay back someone for something like that? But, uh, I don't know. I'm working on something.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She pays me back every day just by being my wife so that's fine.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Awww.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: O-Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Woman 2
Quote.Text: All I can say is, if I had Jim, he would have a free pass to do anything. I mean if I lucked into that... he could do anything. Anything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [pause] I'm sorry. Is there a question?

Quote.Speaker: Woman 2
Quote.Text: Uh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Man 2
Quote.Text: Pam, what was in that teapot letter?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, um, well, you know, I... I just... I just think I would rather keep that private. You know, if you'd been filmed for nine years of your life, there'd be some things that you just wanna keep to yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Man 2
Quote.Text: I hear ya. What did it say?

Quote.Speaker: Moderator
Quote.Text: We're gonna move on. Next question please.

Quote.Speaker: Man 3
Quote.Text: Do you find that your life feels pointless now that nobody's actually filming you anymore?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Woman 3
Quote.Text: I wanna know how everyone felt they were portrayed. Was it accurate?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I got a beef with that. Um, for the first seven years, I was getting my PhD in School Psychology and they didn't show it. Yes, I was getting hammered but, hey, it was college.

Quote.Speaker: Woman 4
Quote.Text: I have a question for Jim and Pam. Everyone watching sees how much you love each other and how you're soul mates. So, Pam, how could you doubt that when Jim moved to Philadelphia?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, you know what, I actually didn't handle that move, uh, very gracefully. From not communicating to being a little selfish.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Listen, um... I was scared, you know? I loved what I had, and I didn't want to risk it. And I think that maybe I did doubt him a little too. Which was wrong because he's shown me time and again. But when the documentary started airing, people on the street told me that I had this fairy-tale romance. But there were a lot of times last year where it did not feel like a fairy tale. But then it got deeper, and it got stronger and now it's better than a fairy tale. It's like a long book that you never want to end. And you're fine with that because you just never, ever wanna leave it.

Quote.Speaker: Woman 4
Quote.Text: Like Harry Potter.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, like Harry Potter.

Quote.Speaker: Joan
Quote.Text: I have a question for Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Joan
Quote.Text: Yes. Um, the thing I found most compelling about the documentary was your search for your birth mother.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Joan
Quote.Text: So my question is, um, do... don't you hate her? I mean, I would just imagine that you were so angry at her that you would hate her.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Maybe sometimes. But not like "hate" hate. More just like, "Mom, I hate you!" And then she would say "go to your room, young lady." And I'd stamp my foot and run upstairs and I have a room, which is really cool. And then we'd just have dinner together. But I don't know. I'd have to meet her. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Joan
Quote.Text: Erin...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Joan
Quote.Text: Um...Oh, Erin..

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes? Is there a follow-up question? [realizes] Mom? [they hug]

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: Erin... Same question but about your dad? [they hug]

Quote.Speaker: Moderator
Quote.Text: Well, this feels like a good place to stop. Let's thank all of our wonderful panelists for being here on this wonderful panel today. [audience claps] Next week at the Scranton Cultural Center don't forget, Irish Step Dancing semifinals. Winning team to Mid-Atlantic. [applause and scattering cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Where's the, uh, basket for gifts?

Quote.Speaker: Usher
Quote.Text: Right there, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dakota
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm Dakota.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Jeff Bomondo. I sell ceramic tile out of Newark.

Quote.Speaker: Dakota
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: My wife's name is Kathryn. I can show you my social security card if it helps.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Uck, Look at all this mud. Can you imagine if I had worn my Jimmy Choos? I just saved you 600 bucks mister.

Quote.Speaker: Ravi
Quote.Text: Thanks for helping out, sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly, you're here.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hey, Ryan!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Whose baby is this? Oh, are, like, a nanny now?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, this little guy is mine.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So I was dating this girl, and one day, she went out to get a new charger for her e-cigarette. Never came back. Oldest story in the book. [baby squeals]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Say "hi", Drake.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Drake is your baby's name?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That is an amazing name. I'm obsessed with Drake. His last album... it just touched me to pieces.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No Kelly, he's no named after a hip-hop artist from 2011. It's Drake, like a mix of Drew and Blake.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Cool. Well, he is so cute. Ravi, check out this cute baby. I'm obsessed with him. Ravi is a pediatrician and some of his patients are total uggos.

Quote.Speaker: Ravi
Quote.Text: They're called premature, sweetie. It's good to see you again Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Let me help you us.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thanks. [knees buckle] Oh. Ouch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, boy. Maybe your heels are too high.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, my heels aren't too high. It's because I spent three hours in a car trunk. Thanks for not locking the door when I asked you to, Phyllis. [sighs] Sorry Phyllis. You didn't know. As long as I can get to the altar.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm gonna get you to that altar. You can take that to the bank.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You ready?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [chuckles] You kidding? I was born ready. [mimicking heavy metal guitars]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, Dwight, Dwight. Um... I don't know how to tell you this, but... we have a little bit of a problem.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no. What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The minister just told me that it's tradition for the Bestish Mensch to be older than the groom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, come on. I've never heard of such a thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I haven't heard of it, obviously. But I'm out because I am significantly younger than you-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not... significant is a big word...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think it's definitely... Well, okay. Either way...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think you're only a teeny...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Either way, Dwight... I can't be there for you. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just...really wish there was something I could do. [looks off]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [turns around] [whispering] Michael. I can't believe you came.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Best prank ever.

Quote.Speaker: Minister
Quote.Text: As it is traditional to the Schrutes, the lovers are standing in their own graves as a reminder that this is the only escape from what they are about to do.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [to Joan] See, I get what they are trying to do, but why are the graves so shallow?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [reading] "Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away. For lo, the winter is passed. The rain is over and gone. The time of singing has come and the voice of the turtledove is heard in our land. Let me see your face. Let me hear your voice for your voice is sweet and your face is comely. "

Quote.Speaker: Minister
Quote.Text: I now pronounce you man and wife. [everyone cheers] Release the doves! [doves do not move right away]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's not...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen. Thank you so much for coming. Now, please take your hay bales to the reception. They'll be used for seating. Complimentary hay hooks are placed alone the aisles. Just stab 'em on in there.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [After Dwight and Angela's dance]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [dancing with Pam. They kiss] See, now you don't owe me anything.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ravi? Ravi? Drake has a bit of a rash. And he's hot.

Quote.Speaker: Ravi
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I was wondering could you maybe examine him for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Ravi
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, you're not feeling well little guy? Okay, sure. Should we go inside?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Actually, could you go inside? I'm feeling a little dehydrated. I could really use a little break, have some water.

Quote.Speaker: Ravi
Quote.Text: Are you sure you don't wanna go in?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ravi, just do it. That baby is burning up. Isn't this, like what you live for? Just go. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thank you Ravi. Thank you so much. This is great for me and for Drake. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know, Ryan. Baby Drake didn't look so good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: He'll be fine. I let me suck on a strawberry. He's allergic but he'll get over it fast. I had to talk to you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You gave your baby an allergic reaction just to talk to me? [they kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael has so many pictures of his kids he had to get two phones with two numbers and he pays two bills.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [with Michael] Oh, my gosh, it's choreographed!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He just so happy to have a family plan.

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: Where'd you learn to dance like that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know. I've just always been really good at dancing.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [dancing with Pam] [sobbing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is it me? Is it Nellie?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [sobbing] It's everything.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [dancing with Stanley] I missed you.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I missed you too.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Lots of people think that Stanley Hudson's a mean old grump. [laughs] But [crying] would a grump make this? It's me. It's me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [laughing] I love you too.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We're gonna be together forever.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: We're running off into the sunset.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I finally mastered commitment.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Oscar] What was that stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Ravi
Quote.Text: Hey, has anyone seen Ryan... or Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh! Yes. Uh, They left together a little while ago. Kelly was hoping that you would keep the baby so they can start a new life together.

Quote.Speaker: Ravi
Quote.Text: Oh, that's it. Here. [hands Drake to Kevin] Call child services and report an abandoned baby. We'll find a better parent than Ryan in no time.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Um, Kevin? Oh, I can help you with that. Yeah. I mean, I can find someone who will... who will love that beautiful little boy the way he deserves.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, this is better. [hands Drake to Nellie]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes. It is. Oh yes it is.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: If Ryan wants his baby back, please tell him where to fine me. We'll be somewhere in Europe. [looking at Drake] Won't we?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [crying] I feel like all my kids grew up and then they married each other. It's every parent's dream.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thank you go much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Great. It was really fun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good evening.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: The Doc crew's throwing a big after party in the warehouse tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, I heard. It sounds kinda lame. [to camera] No offense. You going, Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know. I might turn in early.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's only 6:00. Come on, everybody's going.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You have to go, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah, come on, Tobes.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah. I'll stop by.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: There he is!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I need to get out of this dress.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I gotta get out of this dress.

Quote.Speaker: Carol Stills
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sighs] [whispering] Why are you still here?

Quote.Speaker: Carol
Quote.Text: [whispering] I'm so sorry. They were an hour late.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, really, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, Okay. Um... so... this past year has been really great, and you've been great and I just... I know that you had to make this choice and you had to give something up for me. But I never want you to have to give up anything. I just thought if I could get us an offer then there wouldn't be anything standing in our way and I could come to you with this big Jim gesture... and show you all at once just how much I love you and how much I really do believe in your future.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry, how long have you been showing the house?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: About 2 months

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's why it's so clean.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean, you were gonna do this without me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you... you bought the house without telling me, so I thought I could sell it without telling you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh... okay. Where would we go?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Austin? Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I promise you, you don't have to do this for me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm doing it for us.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The last...

Quote.Speaker: Buyer
Quote.Text: Okay. We'll take it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to the buyer] Hold on a second. [to Pam] The last few months have meant the world to me and all I care about...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hold on a second. [turning] Wait, what did you just say?

Quote.Speaker: Buyer
Quote.Text: We wanna buy your house.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You wanna do this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I wanna do this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You really want to do this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I really want to do this!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hugging Pam] [laughing] Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Darryl. [whispers in his ear]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What? All right!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're so excited.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: Oh, that's for PBS executives only.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I had to pledge $50 to my local PBS station just to get this.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: I think your ideas are fantastic, Oscar. I'd love to contribute to your campaign.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you David.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, could I please have your attention? So a year ago, I got my first art commission to paint a mural for Dunder Mifflin and I decided to paint the history of paper...,which was just some trees and stuff. And then someone spray painted a bunch of butts on it and I had to start from the beginning. But it all worked out for the best because I think that I've painted the perfect thing which is the history of us. All of us. And this is for you Jim. [applause] And go ahead! [drape drops and everyone cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Everyone, Let's take our picture in front of the mural. Oh, um, I just...I kind of meant just everybody from the office.

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: [taking pictures] Very nice. Just a couple dozen more. Smiles, everybody, smiles. All right, that's great. I got enough. Thank you, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispering to Pam] Let's go outside

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Okay, I need a drink.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, we all need a drink. [opening Meredith's drawer] What the...there's only dandelion tea and raisins in here.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, bottom drawer.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [answering the phone] Dunder Mifflin, This is Pam. Oh, I'm sorry. Jim Halpert doesn't work here anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I didn't watch the whole documentary. After a few episodes, it was too painful. I kept wanting to scream at Pam. It took me so long to do so many important things. It's just hard to accept that I spent so many years being less happy than I could have been. Jim was 5 feet from my desk and it took me four years to get to him. It'd be great if people saw this documentary and learned from my mistakes. Not that I'm a tragic person. I'm really happy now. But...it would just...just make my heart soar if someone out there saw this and she said to herself "be strong, trust yourself, love yourself. Conquer your fears. Just go after what you want and act fast, because life just isn't that long."

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: If there is one thing that I have learned through this whole experience, it's that if you film anybody long enough, they're going to do something stupid. It's only human natural.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What about the honeymoon?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, the honeymoon can wait till tomorrow. We wanted to hang out with you guys. I mean, when are we all going to be here together again?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aww, J, P and D. The Three Amigos. Ah, it warms my heart. Hey, what do you say, when I get back from out honeymoon, the three of us have a conference room meeting just for fun? [pause] What is that meaningful look?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Maybe we should talk.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, come here. You guys need to see this.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on the computer] You're probably sitting there wondering what will be your mark. What will you be known for? It might surprise you to learn...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I finally feel ready. Athlead is growing...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Athleap.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And Jim can jump back in without skipping a beat. We'll come back to visit. But I think it's time for us to officially...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, don't say it. You're fired! You're both fired!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, come on. Don't end on a bad note.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't be an idiot. It's for the severance. The best I can do one month for every year you've been here. That's the max.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, and if you're ever in Austin...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Woah. Right. For what, the art? The music? The incredible nightlife? No thank you. But if you're ever in the area, you'll always have a place to stay...in my barn.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There it is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do I get along with my co-workers? Well, first of all, I don't have co-workers anymore, I have subordinates. So... have I gotten along with my subordinates? Let's see. My supplier relations rep, Meredith Palmer, is the only person I know who knows how to properly head bang to Motorhead. Oscar Martinez, my accountant, is now godfather to my son. Angela Schrute, my former accountant is now my wife. My top salesman, Jim Halpert was best man at my wedding and office administrator Pamela Beesley Halpert is my best friend. So...yes. I'd say I have gotten along with my subordinates.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on computer] You might feel sorry for me but I actually feel sorry for you. Because you're about to leave Cornell. So say it with me: [all]: Oh, I can so just sit here and cry.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You did good. Real good.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks Dad...Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I spent so much of my time here at Dunder Mifflin thinking about my old pals, my college a cappella group. The weird thing is now, I'm exactly where I wanna be. I got my dream job at Cornell and I'm still just thinking about my old pals. Only now they're the ones I made here. I wish there was a way to know you're in the good old days before you've actually left them. [pause] Someone should write a song about that.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You take something ordinary, like a piece of paper. It's not much. But if you see it in the right way...And that's what you did with this documentary. But seriously, you made a nine-year documentary and you couldn't once show me doing my origami.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [walking out of the bathroom discovered by all] Uh..ohh!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [playing guitar and singing] I saw a friend today. It had been a while. And we forgot each others names. But it didn't matter. 'Cause deep inside the feeling still remained the same...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Imagine going back and watching a tape of your life. You could see yourself change and make mistakes...and grow up. You could watch yourself fall in love, watch yourself become a husband, become a father. You guys gave that to me. And that's...an amazing gift.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim, remember flonkerton when you did Office Olympics? It was awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks Phyl.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I still have my medal from that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do you even have a mattress?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No, but I still have my medal from that.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oscar. Oscar. [crying] I think I'm gay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why do you say that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [sniffles] It's just that I'm so emotional.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, but you're not gay. You're not gay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, but maybe the reason...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're not gay.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [still playing and singing] And all the faces that I know have that same familiar glow. I think I must have known them somewhere once before.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How did you do it? How did you capture what it was really like? How we felt and how made each other laugh and how we got through the day? How did you do it? Also, how do cameras work?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Everyday when I came into work, all I wanted to do was leave. So why in the world does it feel so hard to leave right now?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: It all seems so very arbitrary. I applied for a job at this company because they were hiring. I took a desk at the back because it was empty. But...[chuckles] no matter how you get there or where you end up, human beings have this miraculous gift to make that place home. [standing with two cops] Let's do this.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I just feel lucky that I got a chance to share my crummy story with anyone out there who thinks they're the only one to take a dump in a paper shredder. You're not alone sister. Let's get a beer sometime.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm happy that this was all filmed so I can remember everyone and what we did. I worked for a paper company all these years and I never wrote anything down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I sold paper at this company for 12 years. My job was to speak to clients on the phone about quantities and types of copier paper. Even if I didn't love every minute of it, everything I have, I owe to this job. This stupid...wonderful...boring...amazing job.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I thought it was weird when you picked us to make a documentary. But all in all...I think an ordinary paper company like Dunder Mifflin was a great subject for a documentary. There's a lot of beauty in ordinary things. Isn't that kind of the point?
